text: A record of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham was the father of Isaac. Isaac was the father of Jacob. Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah, whose mother was Tamar. Perez was the father of Hezron. Hezron was the father of Ram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ram was the father of Amminadab. Amminadab was the father of Nahshon. Nahshon was the father of Salmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salmon was the father of Boaz, whose mother was Rahab. Boaz was the father of Obed, whose mother was Ruth. Obed was the father of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesse was the father of King David.
David was the father of Solomon, whose mother had been the wife of Uriah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon was the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam was the father of Abijah. Abijah was the father of Asa.
speaker: Narrator

text: Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat was the father of Joram. Joram was the father of Uzziah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzziah was the father of Jotham. Jotham was the father of Ahaz. Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh. Manasseh was the father of Amon. Amon was the father of Josiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Josiah was the father of Jeconiah and his brothers, at the time of the Babylonian exile.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the Babylonian exile, Jeconiah was the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud. Abiud was the father of Eliakim. Eliakim was the father of Azor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azor was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of Achim. Achim was the father of Eliud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliud was the father of Eleazar. Eleazar was the father of Matthan. Matthan was the father of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob was the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom Jesus was born (who is called Christ).
speaker: Narrator

text: So altogether there were fourteen generations from Abraham to David, fourteen generations from David to the Babylonian exile, and fourteen generations from the Babylonian exile to Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is how the birth of Jesus Christ took place. His mother, Mary, was pledged in marriage to Joseph. Before they came together, she was found to be with child by the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph, her husband, was a righteous man and did not want to disgrace her. So he decided to divorce her privately.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as he was considering these things, an angel of the Lord suddenly appeared to him in a dream and said, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because the child conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All this happened to fulfill what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Look, the virgin will be with child and will give birth to a son. And they will name him Immanuel,” which means, “God with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joseph woke up from his sleep, he did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him. He took Mary home as his wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he was not intimate with her until she gave birth to her firstborn son. And he named him Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea, when Herod was king, Wise Men from the east came to Jerusalem. They asked,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Where is he who has been born King of the Jews? We saw his star when it rose and have come to worship him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When King Herod heard this, he was alarmed, and all Jerusalem with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gathered together all the people’s chief priests and experts in the law. He asked them where the Christ was to be born.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, because this was written through the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text: You, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are certainly not least among the rulers of Judah: because out of you will come a ruler, who will shepherd my people, Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Herod secretly summoned the Wise Men and found out from them exactly when the star had appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and search carefully for the child. When you find him, report to me, so that I may also go and worship him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After listening to the king, they went on their way. Then the star they had seen when it rose went ahead of them, until it stood still over the place where the child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with overwhelming joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they went into the house and saw the child with Mary, his mother, they bowed down and worshipped him. Then they opened their treasures and offered him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since they had been warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they went back to their own country by another route.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the Wise Men were gone, an angel of the Lord suddenly appeared to Joseph in a dream. He said, “Get up, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, because Herod will search for the child in order to kill him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph got up, took the child and his mother during the night, and left for Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He stayed there until the death of Herod. This happened to fulfill what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet: “Out of Egypt I called my son.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Herod realized that he had been outwitted by the Wise Men, he was furious. He issued orders to kill all the boys in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under. This was in keeping with the exact time he had learned from the Wise Men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then what was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled:
speaker: Narrator

text:
A voice was heard in Ramah,
    weeping and great mourning,
    Rachel weeping for her children,
    and she refused to be comforted,
    because they are no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Herod died, an angel of the Lord suddenly appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt. The angel said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Get up, take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who were trying to kill the child are dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and went to the land of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he heard that Archelaus, Herod’s son, had succeeded his father as ruler in Judea, he was afraid to go there. Since he had been warned in a dream, he went to the region of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he arrived there, he settled in a city called Nazareth. So what was spoken through the prophets was fulfilled: “He will be called a Nazarene.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days, John the Baptist appeared, preaching in the wilderness of Judea and saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Repent, because the kingdom of heaven is near!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, this is he of whom this was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:
A voice of one crying out in the wilderness,
“Prepare the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John wore clothing made of camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jerusalem, all of Judea, and all the region around the Jordan were going out to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were baptized by him in the Jordan River as they confessed their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore produce fruit in keeping with repentance!
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not think of saying to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you that God is able to raise up children for Abraham from these stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Already the ax is ready to strike the root of the trees. So every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: I baptize you with water for repentance. But the one who comes after me is mightier than I. I am not worthy to carry his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: His winnowing shovel is in his hand, and he will thoroughly clean out his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the barn, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to be baptized by John at the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: But John tried to stop him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and yet you come to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answered him, “Let it be so now, because it is proper for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then John let him.
speaker: Jesus

text: After Jesus was baptized, he immediately went up out of the water. Suddenly, the heavens were opened for him! He saw the Spirit of God, descending like a dove and landing on him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a voice out of the heavens said, “This is my Son, whom I love. I am well pleased with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the Devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Tempter came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command these stones to become bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Jesus answered, “It is written:
Man shall not live by bread alone,
but by every word that comes out of the mouth of God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the Devil took him into the holy city. He placed him on the pinnacle of the temple,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and he said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down. For it is written:
He will command his angels concerning you. And they will lift you up in their hands,
so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to him, “Again, it is written:
You shall not test the Lord your God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Again the Devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him, “I will give you all of these things, if you will bow down and worship me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Jesus said to him, “Go away, Satan! For it is written:
Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the Devil left him, and just then angels came and served him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard that John was put in prison, he withdrew into Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Nazareth and went to live in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did this to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali,
    along the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan,
    Galilee of the Gentiles,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the people dwelling in darkness have seen a great light,
    and on those dwelling in the region and the shadow of death a light has dawned.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time, Jesus began to preach: “Repent, because the kingdom of heaven is near.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus was walking by the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon, who is called Peter, and his brother Andrew. They were casting a net into the sea, since they were fishermen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Come, follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They immediately left their nets and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and his brother John. They were in the boat with their father Zebedee, mending their nets. Jesus called them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus traveled throughout Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: News about him spread throughout all Syria. People brought to him all who were ill with various diseases and suffering severe pains, the demon-possessed, those who experienced seizures, and the paralyzed. Then he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Large crowds followed him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw the crowds, he went up onto a mountain. When he sat down, his disciples came to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He opened his mouth and began to teach them. He said these things:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Blessed are the poor in spirit,
    because theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are those who mourn,
    because they will be comforted.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are the gentle,
    because they will inherit the earth.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
    because they will be filled.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are the merciful,
    because they will receive mercy.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are the pure in heart,
    because they will see God.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are the peacemakers,
    because they will be called sons of God.
speaker: Jesus

text:
Blessed are those who are persecuted because of righteousness,
    because theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are you when people insult you and persecute you and falsely say all kinds of evil against you because of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Rejoice and be glad, because great is your reward in heaven. In fact, that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the salt of the earth, but if salt has lost its flavor, how will it become salty again? Then it is no good for anything except to be thrown out and trampled on by people.
speaker: Jesus

text: You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill cannot be hidden.
speaker: Jesus

text: People do not light a lamp and put it under a basket. No, they put it on a stand, and it gives light to all who are in the house.
speaker: Jesus

text: In the same way let your light shine in people’s presence, so that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I came to destroy the Law or the Prophets. I did not come to destroy them but to fulfill them.
speaker: Jesus

text: Amen I tell you: Until heaven and earth pass away, not even the smallest letter, or even part of a letter, will in any way pass away from the Law until everything is fulfilled.
speaker: Jesus

text: So whoever breaks one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do the same will be called least in the kingdom of heaven. But whoever practices and teaches them will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Indeed I tell you that unless your righteousness surpasses that of the Pharisees and experts in the law, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said to people long ago, ‘You shall not murder, and whoever murders will be subject to judgment.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause will be subject to judgment, and whoever says to his brother, ‘Raca,’ will have to answer to the Sanhedrin. But whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be in danger of hell fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: “So if you are about to offer your gift at the altar, and there you remember that your brother has something against you,
speaker: Jesus

text: leave your gift there in front of the altar and go. First be reconciled to your brother. Then come and offer your gift.
speaker: Jesus

text: “If someone accuses you, reach an agreement with him quickly, while you are with him on the way. Otherwise your accuser may bring you to the judge, and the judge may hand you over to the officer, and you will be thrown into prison.
speaker: Jesus

text: Amen I tell you: You will never get out until you have paid the last penny.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery,’
speaker: Jesus

text: but I tell you that everyone who looks at a woman with lust has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
speaker: Jesus

text: If your right eye causes you to fall into sin, pluck it out and throw it away from you. It is better for you to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: If your right hand causes you to fall into sin, cut it off and throw it away from you. It is better for you to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: “It was also said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife must give her a certificate of divorce.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you that whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, causes her to be regarded as an adulteress. And whoever marries the divorced woman is regarded as an adulterer.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Again you have heard that it was said to people long ago, ‘Do not break your oaths, but fulfill your vows to the Lord.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you, do not swear at all: not by heaven, because it is God’s throne;
speaker: Jesus

text: and not by earth, because it is his footstool; and not by Jerusalem, because it is the city of the great King.
speaker: Jesus

text: And do not swear by your own head, since you cannot make one hair white or black.
speaker: Jesus

text: Instead, let your statement be, ‘Yes, yes,’ or ‘No, no.’ Whatever goes beyond these is from the Evil One.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you, do not resist an evildoer. If someone strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other also.
speaker: Jesus

text: If anyone wants to sue you to take away your shirt, give him your coat too.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give to the one who asks you, and do not turn away from the one who wants to borrow from you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that you may be children of your Father who is in heaven. For he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.
speaker: Jesus

text: Indeed if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Even tax collectors do that, don’t they?
speaker: Jesus

text: If you greet only your brothers, what are you doing more than others? Do not even the unbelievers do that?
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Be careful that you do not do your righteous works in front of people, so that they will notice. If you do, you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: So whenever you perform acts of mercy, do not sound a trumpet for yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the streets to be praised by people. Amen I tell you: They have received their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: Instead, when you perform acts of mercy, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then your acts of mercy will be in secret, and your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whenever you pray, do not be like the hypocrites. They love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the street corners so that they may be seen by people. Amen I tell you: They have received their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: But whenever you pray, go into your private room, close your door, and pray to your Father who is unseen. And your Father, who sees what others cannot see, will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “And when you pray, do not babble like the heathen, since they think that they will be heard because of their many words.
speaker: Jesus

text: However do not be like them, because your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore pray like this: ‘Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name.
speaker: Jesus

text: Your kingdom come. Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give us today our daily bread.
speaker: Jesus

text: Forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.
speaker: Jesus

text: Lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.’
speaker: Jesus

text: “Indeed if you forgive people when they sin against you, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if you do not forgive people their sins, your Father will not forgive your sins.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whenever you fast, do not make yourself look sad like the hypocrites, for they disfigure their faces to show everyone that they are fasting. Amen I tell you: They have received their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: But when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that it is not apparent to people that you are fasting, but only to your Father who sees what is unseen. Then your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not store up treasures for yourselves on earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal.
speaker: Jesus

text: But store up treasures for yourselves in heaven, where moth and rust do not destroy, and where thieves do not break in and steal.
speaker: Jesus

text: Because where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
speaker: Jesus

text: “The eye is the lamp of the body. So then if your eye is healthy, your whole body will be full of light.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. So if the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and mammon.
speaker: Jesus

text: “For this reason I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or drink, or about your body, what you will wear. Is not life more than food and the body more than clothing?
speaker: Jesus

text: Look at the birds of the air. They do not sow or reap or gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not worth much more than they?
speaker: Jesus

text: “Which of you can add a single moment to his lifespan by worrying?
speaker: Jesus

text: Why do you worry about clothing? Consider how the lilies of the field grow. They do not labor or spin,
speaker: Jesus

text: but I tell you that not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed like one of these.
speaker: Jesus

text: If that is how God clothes the grass of the field, which is alive today and tomorrow is thrown into the furnace, will he not clothe you even more, you of little faith?
speaker: Jesus

text: “So do not worry, saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or ‘What will we drink?’ or ‘What will we wear?’
speaker: Jesus

text: For the unbelievers chase after all these things. Certainly your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
speaker: Jesus

text: But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
speaker: Jesus

text: So do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will care for itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.”
speaker: Jesus

text: “Stop judging, so that you will not be judged.
speaker: Jesus

text: For with whatever standard you judge, you will be judged, and with whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Why do you focus on the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not consider the beam that is in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: How will you tell your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye,’ when, in fact, you have a beam in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: Hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not give dogs what is holy, and do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they will trample them under their feet and turn and tear you to pieces.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Keep asking, and it will be given to you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened for you.
speaker: Jesus

text: For everyone who asks receives, and everyone who seeks finds, and to the one who knocks, it will be opened.
speaker: Jesus

text: Who among you, if his son asks him for bread, would give him a stone?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or who, if his son asks for a fish, would give him a snake?
speaker: Jesus

text: Then if you know how to give good gifts to your children, even though you are evil, how much more will your Father in heaven give good gifts to those who ask him!
speaker: Jesus

text: “So do for others whatever you want people to do for you, because this is the Law and the Prophets.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Enter through the narrow gate, for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and many are those who enter through it.
speaker: Jesus

text: How narrow is the gate, and how difficult is the way that leads to life, and there are few who find it.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Watch out for false prophets. They come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves.
speaker: Jesus

text: By their fruit you will recognize them. You do not gather grapes from thorn bushes or figs from thistles, do you?
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, every good tree produces good fruit, but a bad tree produces bad fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, and a bad tree cannot produce good fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: Every tree that does not produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: So then, by their fruit you will recognize them.
speaker: Jesus

text: Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only the one who does the will of my Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name and drive out demons in your name and perform many miracles in your name?’
speaker: Jesus

text: Then I will tell them plainly, ‘I never knew you. Depart from me, you evildoers.’
speaker: Jesus

text: “Everyone who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on bedrock.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain came down, the rivers rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house. But it did not fall, because it was founded on bedrock.
speaker: Jesus

text: Everyone who hears these words of mine but does not do them will be like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain came down, the rivers rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell—it was completely destroyed.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus finished speaking these words, the crowds were amazed at his teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: because he taught them as one who had authority, and not like their experts in the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus came down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then, a leper came to him and bowed down to him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him. “I am willing,” he said. “Be clean.” Immediately he was healed of his leprosy.
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one. Instead, go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When he entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him and pleaded with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed and suffering terribly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The centurion answered, “Lord, I am not worthy for you to come under my roof. But only say the word, and my servant will be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am also a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I say to this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, he marveled. He said to those who were following him, “Amen I tell you: I have not found such great faith in anyone in Israel.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west and will recline at the table with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the children of the kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus said to the centurion, “Go. Let it be done for you as you have believed.” And his servant was healed at that very hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw Peter’s mother-in-law sick in bed with a fever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. She got up and began to serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening came, they brought to him many who were demon-possessed. He drove out the spirits with a word and healed all who were sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was to fulfill what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet: “He took up our weaknesses and carried away our diseases.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw a large crowd gathering around him, he gave orders to go over to the other shore.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then an expert in the law came and said to him, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Another of his disciples said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus told him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When he got into a boat, his disciples followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly a terrible storm came up on the sea, so that their boat was covered by the waves. But Jesus was sleeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went and woke him, saying, “Lord, save us! We’re going to die!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Why are you afraid, you of little faith?” Then he got up, rebuked the wind and the sea, and there was a complete calm.
speaker: Jesus

text: The men were amazed, saying, “What kind of a man is this? Even the wind and the sea obey him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he arrived at the other side, in the region of the Gergesenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him there. They were very dangerous, so that nobody could pass that way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly they cried out, “What do we have to do with you, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a large herd of pigs feeding some distance away from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The demons begged him, “If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He told them, “Go!”
So the demons came out of the men and went into the pigs. Immediately the whole herd of pigs rushed down the steep bank into the sea and drowned in the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were feeding the pigs fled and went into the town. They reported everything, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the entire town came out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him to leave their region.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus got into a boat, crossed over, and came to his own town.
speaker: Narrator

text: There people brought to him a man who was paralyzed, lying on a stretcher. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man, “Take heart, son! Your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then some of the experts in the law said among themselves, “This fellow is blaspheming!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Since Jesus knew their thoughts, he said, “Why are you thinking evil in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
speaker: Jesus

text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” he then said to the paralyzed man, “Get up, take your stretcher, and go home.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The man got up and went home.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowd saw this, they were filled with awe and glorified God, who had given such authority to men.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting in the tax collector’s booth. He said to him, “Follow me.” Matthew got up and followed him.
speaker: Jesus

text: As Jesus was reclining at the table in Matthew’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were actually there too, eating with Jesus and his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, he said to them, “The healthy do not need a physician, but the sick do.
speaker: Jesus

text: Go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice.’ In fact, I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then John’s disciples came to him and said, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast at all?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Can the attendants of the bridegroom mourn while the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.
speaker: Jesus

text: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, because the patch would tear away from the garment, and the hole would be made even worse.
speaker: Narrator

text: And people do not pour new wine into old wineskins. If they did, the skins would burst, the wine would be spilled, and the skins would be ruined. Instead they pour new wine into fresh wineskins. By doing that, both are preserved.”
speaker: Jesus

text: As he was saying these things to them, there was a ruler who came, bowed down to him, and said, “My daughter has just died. But come, place your hand on her, and she will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus got up and followed him, as did his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then, a woman who had been suffering from chronic bleeding for twelve years came up from behind and touched the fringe of his garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: For she had been saying to herself, “If I just touch his garment, I will be healed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus turned around and saw her, he said, “Take heart, daughter! Your faith has healed you.” And the woman was healed from that moment.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus came into the ruler’s house and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he said to them, “Go away, for the girl is not dead but is sleeping.”
But they laughed at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowd was sent out of the house, Jesus went in, took the girl by the hand, and she was raised.
speaker: Narrator

text: News of this went out through the entire region.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus left that place, two blind men followed him, calling out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he entered the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?”
They told him, “Yes, Lord.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then he touched their eyes and said, “According to your faith let it be done for you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And their eyes were opened. Then Jesus warned them emphatically, “See to it that no one learns about this.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But they went out and spread the word about him throughout that entire region.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as they were leaving, people brought to him a demon-possessed man who could not talk.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the demon was driven out, the mute man spoke. The crowds were amazed and said, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees said, “He drives out demons by the ruler of demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus traveled through all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw the crowds, he was moved with compassion for them, because they were troubled and downcast, like sheep without a shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore pray that the Lord of the harvest will send out workers into his harvest.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus called his twelve disciples to himself and gave them authority to drive out unclean spirits and to heal every disease and every sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the twelve apostles: first, Simon (who is called Peter) and his brother Andrew; James the son of Zebedee and his brother John;
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon the Zealot and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus sent these twelve out and commanded them, “Do not go among the Gentiles, and do not enter any town of the Samaritans.
speaker: Jesus

text: Go instead to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you go, preach this message: ‘The kingdom of heaven is near!’
speaker: Jesus

text: Heal the sick. Raise the dead. Cleanse lepers. Drive out demons. Freely you have received; freely give.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not take gold, silver, or bronze in your money belts.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not take a bag for the journey, or two coats, sandals, or a staff, because the worker deserves his support.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whenever you enter a town or village, find out who is worthy and stay there until you leave.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you enter the household, give it your greeting.
speaker: Jesus

text: If the household is worthy, let your peace rest on it. But if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: If anyone does not receive you or listen to your words, shake the dust off your feet as you leave that house or that town.
speaker: Jesus

text: Amen I tell you: It will be more bearable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Look, I am sending you out as sheep among wolves. So be as shrewd as snakes and as innocent as doves.
speaker: Jesus

text: Be on guard against people. They will hand you over to councils, and they will whip you in their synagogues.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will be brought into the presence of governors and kings for my sake, as a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whenever they hand you over, do not be worried about how you will respond or what you will say, because what you say will be given to you in that hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: In fact you will not be the ones speaking, but the Spirit of your Father will be speaking through you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Brother will hand over his brother to death, and a father will do the same with his child. Children will rise up against parents and have them put to death.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will be hated by all people because of my name, but whoever endures to the end will be saved.
speaker: Jesus

text: And when they persecute you in one town, flee to the next. Amen I tell you: You will not finish going through the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
speaker: Jesus

text: “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor is a servant above his master.
speaker: Jesus

text: It is enough for the disciple to be like his teacher and the servant like his master. If the master of the house was called Beelzebul, how much more the members of his household!
speaker: Jesus

text: “So do not be afraid of them, because there is nothing concealed that will not be revealed, and nothing hidden that will not be made known.
speaker: Jesus

text: What I tell you in the dark, speak in the daylight; and what you hear whispered in your ear, proclaim from the housetops.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Rather, fear the one who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Are not two sparrows sold for a small coin? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground without the knowledge and consent of your Father.
speaker: Jesus

text: And even the hairs of your head are all numbered.
speaker: Jesus

text: So do not be afraid. You are worth more than many sparrows.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Everyone who confesses me before others, I will also confess before my Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: But whoever denies me before others, I will also deny before my Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I came to bring peace to the earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.
speaker: Jesus

text: For I came to turn a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.
speaker: Jesus

text: A man’s enemies will be the members of his own household.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and whoever loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever does not take up his cross and follow me is not worthy of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever finds his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever receives you receives me, and whoever receives me receives him who sent me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever receives a prophet because he is a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. Whoever receives a righteous man because he is a righteous man will receive a righteous man’s reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever gives one of these little ones even a cup of cold water to drink because he is my disciple—Amen I tell you—he will never lose his reward.”
speaker: Jesus

text: After Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he moved on from there to teach and preach in their towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: While John was in prison, he heard about the things Christ was doing. He sent two of his disciples
speaker: Narrator

text: to ask him, “Are you the Coming One or should we wait for someone else?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Go, report to John what you hear and see:
speaker: Narrator

text: The blind receive sight, the lame walk, those who have leprosy are cured, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the gospel is preached to the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the one who does not take offense at me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As these two were leaving, Jesus began to talk to the crowds about John. “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: What did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? No, those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you! And he is much more than a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the one about whom it is written, ‘Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you: Among those born of women there has not appeared anyone greater than John the Baptist. Yet whoever is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the days of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of heaven has been advancing forcefully and forceful people are seizing it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are willing to receive it, he is the Elijah who was to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: “To what will I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces who call to others,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘We played the flute for you, but you did not dance. We sang a dirge, but you did not mourn.’
speaker: Narrator

text: John did not come eating or drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘See, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her actions.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus began to denounce the towns in which most of his miracles were performed, because they did not repent.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles which were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you, it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You, Capernaum, will you be lifted up to heaven? No, you will go down to hell. For if the miracles performed in you had been performed in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you that it will be more bearable for the land of Sodom on the day of judgment than for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, Jesus continued, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from clever and learned people and have revealed them to little children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, Father, because this was pleasing to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything has been entrusted to me by my Father. No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son wants to reveal him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come to me all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, because I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my yoke is easy and my burden is light.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, Jesus went through the grain fields on the Sabbath. His disciples were hungry and began to pick heads of grain and eat them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Pharisees saw it, they said to him, “Look, what your disciples are doing is unlawful on the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?
speaker: Narrator

text: He entered God’s house and ate the Bread of the Presence, which was lawful only for the priests to eat, not for him or his companions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or have you not read in the law that on the Sabbath days, the priests in the temple violate the Sabbath and yet are innocent?
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you that one greater than the temple is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the innocent.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Going on from there, he went into their synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man was there who had a withered hand. Looking for a way to accuse Jesus, they asked him, “Is it lawful to heal on Sabbath days?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Who among you, if you have one sheep that falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will not take hold of it and lift it out?
speaker: Narrator

text: How much more valuable is a man than a sheep! So it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he told the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and it was restored, as healthy as the other one.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees went out and plotted against him, considering how they might put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since Jesus was aware of this, he withdrew from that place. Large crowds followed him and he healed them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: He ordered them not to tell others about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened to fulfill what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Here is my servant whom I have chosen,
    the one I love, in whom I am well pleased.
    I will put my Spirit on him,
    and he will proclaim justice to the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not quarrel or cry out,
    and no one will hear his voice in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A bruised reed he will not break.
    A smoldering wick he will not put out,
    until he leads justice to victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in his name the nations will hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a demon-possessed man who was blind and unable to speak was brought to him. Jesus healed him so that he was able to speak and to see.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people were amazed and said, “Can this be the Son of David?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, “It is only by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons, that this fellow drives out demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is destroyed, and every town or household divided against itself will not stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Satan drives out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then can his kingdom stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if I drive out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons drive them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I drive out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or how can someone enter a strong man’s house and take his goods, unless he first ties up the strong man? Only then can he plunder his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whoever is not with me is against me. And whoever does not gather with me scatters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I tell you, people will be forgiven every sin and blasphemy, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven—either in this age or in the one to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Either make a tree good and its fruit will be good, or make a tree bad and its fruit will be bad. Indeed, a tree is known by its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: You offspring of vipers! How can you say anything good, since you are evil? For what the mouth speaks flows from the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good man brings good out of his good treasure, and the evil man brings evil out of his evil treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that on the day of judgment people will give account of every careless word they have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the experts in the law and Pharisees replied, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation wishes for a sign, but no sign will be given it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as Jonah was in the belly of the huge fish for three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah. But one even greater than Jonah is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Queen of the South will be raised up in the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. But one even greater than Solomon is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When an unclean spirit has gone out of someone, it passes through dry places looking for rest, but it does not find it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it says, ‘I will return to the home I came from.’ And when it has returned, it finds the place empty, swept, and put in order.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it takes along with it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter in and live there. So the last condition of that person becomes worse than the first. That is how it will be for this evil generation too.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking to the crowd, his mother and his brothers happened to be standing outside, wanting to talk to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Someone said to him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to talk to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he replied to the one who told him, “Who is my mother? And who are my brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He reached out his hand toward his disciples and said, “See, my mother and my brothers!
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That same day Jesus left the house and was sitting by the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: A large crowd gathered around him. So he stepped into a boat and sat down, while all the people stood on the shore.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them many things in parables, saying: “Listen, a sower went out to sow.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he sowed, some seed fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell on rocky ground, where it did not have much soil. Immediately the seed sprang up, because the soil was not deep.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the sun rose, the seed was scorched. Because it had no root, it withered away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some seed fell on good ground and produced grain: some one hundred times, some sixty, and some thirty times more than was sown.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples came and said to him, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “To you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but it has not been given to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever has will be given even more, and he will have an abundance. But whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is why I speak to them in parables, because even though they see, they do not see; and even though they hear, they do not hear or understand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled which says,
You will hear clearly, but you will never understand. You will see clearly, but you will never perceive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because this people’s heart has grown callous, their ears are hard of hearing. They have closed their eyes. Otherwise they would see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, turn, and I would heal them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But blessed are your eyes because they see and your ears because they hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you: Many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you are seeing, but they did not see it. They longed to hear what you are hearing, but they did not hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So listen carefully to the parable of the sower.
speaker: Narrator

text: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand it, the Evil One comes and snatches away what has been sown in his heart. This is the seed that was sown along the path.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed that was sown on rocky ground is the person who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet he is not deeply rooted and does not endure. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, he immediately falls away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seed that was sown among the thorns is the one who hears the word, but the worry of this world and the deceitfulness of wealth choke the word, and it produces no fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the seed that was sown on the good ground is the one who continues to hear and understand the word. Indeed he continues to produce fruit: some a hundred, some sixty, and some thirty times more than was sown.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He presented another parable to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: But while people were sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the plants sprouted and produced heads of grain, the weeds also appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: The servants of the owner came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? Where did the weeds come from?’
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, ‘An enemy did this.’ The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and gather up the weeds?’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘No,’ he answered, ‘because when you gather up the weeds, you might pull up the wheat along with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and at harvest time I will tell the reapers, “First, gather up the weeds, bind them in bundles, and burn them. Then, gather the wheat into my barn.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: He presented another parable to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his field.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is one of the smallest of seeds. But when it grows, it is larger than the other plants and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and nest in its branches.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke another parable to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast, which a woman took and mixed into a bushel of flour until the whole batch was leavened.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the crowds. He did not speak to them without telling a parable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:
I will open my mouth in parables,
I will utter things hidden since the foundation of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus sent the people away and went into the house. His disciples came to him and said, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds in the field.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “The one who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The field is the world. The good seeds are the sons of the kingdom. The weeds are the sons of the Evil One.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enemy who sowed them is the Devil. The harvest is the end of the world. The reapers are angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, just as the weeds are gathered up and burned with fire, so it will be at the end of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will pull out of his kingdom everything that causes sin and those who continue to break the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angels will throw them into the fiery furnace where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a treasure hidden in a field, which a man found and hid again. In his joy, he goes away and sells all that he has and buys that field.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant seeking fine pearls.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he found one very valuable pearl, he went and sold all that he had and bought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and gathered fish of every kind.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the net was filled, they pulled it onto the shore. They sat down and gathered the good fish into containers, but threw the bad ones away.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is how it will be at the end of the world. The angels will go out and separate the wicked from the righteous who are among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will throw the wicked into the fiery furnace where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to them, “Did you understand all these things?”
They answered him, “Yes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Therefore every expert in the law who has been trained as a disciple in the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house who brings out of his treasure both new things and old things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had finished these parables, he left that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus entered his hometown and taught in their synagogue. As a result, the people were amazed and said, “Where did this fellow get this wisdom and these miracles?
speaker: Narrator

text: Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother named Mary? And aren’t James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas his brothers?
speaker: Narrator

text: And aren’t all of his sisters here with us? Where then did this fellow get all of these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they took offense at him.
But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own hometown and in his own house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not do many miracles there because of their unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, Herod the tetrarch heard the news about Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist! He has risen from the dead! That is why these powers are working in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Herod had arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison because of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip.
speaker: Narrator

text: John had been telling him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Although Herod wanted to put him to death, he feared the crowd, because they regarded him as a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when it was Herod’s birthday, the daughter of Herodias danced among them. This pleased Herod.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he promised with an oath to give her whatever she might ask.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptist.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Although this saddened the king, because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he ordered that it be done.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent the order and had John beheaded in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: His head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: John’s disciples came, took the body, and buried it. Then they went and reported this to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat to a deserted place to be alone. When the crowds heard this, they followed him on foot from the towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus got out of the boat, he saw a large crowd. He had compassion on them and healed their sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening came, his disciples came to him and said, “This is a deserted place and the hour is already late. Send the crowds away, so that they can go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to them, “They do not need to go away. You give them something to eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They told him, “We have here only five loaves and two fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Bring them here to me,” he replied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he instructed the people to sit down on the grass. He took the five loaves and the two fish. After looking up to heaven, he blessed them. He broke the loaves and gave them to the disciples. The disciples gave the food to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were filled. They picked up twelve basketfuls of what was left over from the broken pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who ate were about five thousand men, not even counting women and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately Jesus urged the disciples to get into the boat and to go ahead of him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he had dismissed the crowd, he went up onto the mountain by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: By then the boat was quite a distance from shore, being pounded by the waves because the wind was against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fourth watch of the night, Jesus came toward them, walking on the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were terrified and cried out in fear, “It’s a ghost!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus spoke to them at once, saying, “Take heart! It is I! Do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter answered him and said, “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the water.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said, “Come!”
Peter stepped down from the boat, walked on the water, and went toward Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw the strong wind, he was afraid. As he began to sink, he cried out, “Lord, save me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand, took hold of him, and said to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they got into the boat, the wind stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were in the boat worshipped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had crossed over, they came to the shore at Gennesaret.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the men of that place recognized him, they sent word into all the surrounding region. They brought to him all who were sick
speaker: Narrator

text: and begged that they might just touch the fringe of his garment. All who touched it were completely cured.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees and experts in the law came to Jesus from Jerusalem and asked,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? They do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “And why do you break the commandment of God for the sake of your tradition?
speaker: Narrator

text: For example, God said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever speaks evil of his father or mother should be put to death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you say that if someone tells his father or mother, ‘Whatever help you might have received from me has been dedicated as a gift to God,’
speaker: Narrator

text: that man does not need to honor his father or his mother. And so you set aside the word of God for the sake of your tradition.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you:
speaker: Narrator

text: These people honor me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They worship me in vain, teaching human rules as if they are doctrines.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he summoned the crowd and said to them, “Listen and understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: What goes into the mouth does not make a person unclean, but it is what comes out of the mouth that defiles a person.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came and said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees took offense when they heard this saying?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “Every plant which my heavenly Father did not plant will be uprooted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them go. They are blind guides of the blind. And if the blind are guiding the blind, both will fall into a pit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter replied and said to him, “Explain the parable to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Do you still not understand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not understand that whatever enters the mouth goes into the stomach and is eliminated into the latrine?
speaker: Narrator

text: But whatever comes out of the mouth comes from the heart. That is what defiles a person.
speaker: Narrator

text: To be sure, out of the heart come evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, sexual sins, thefts, false testimonies, and blasphemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the things that defile a person. But to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a person.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus left that place and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: There a Canaanite woman from that territory came and kept crying out, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! A demon is severely tormenting my daughter!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he did not answer her a word.
His disciples came and pleaded, “Send her away, because she keeps crying out after us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But she came and knelt in front of him, saying, “Lord, help me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered her, “It is not good to take the children’s bread and throw it to their little dogs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yes, Lord,” she said, “yet their little dogs also eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, your faith is great! It will be done for you, just as you desire.” And her daughter was healed at that very hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus moved on from there and went along the Sea of Galilee. He went up onto the mountain and sat there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Large crowds came to him, bringing with them the lame, the blind, the crippled, those unable to speak, and many others. They put them down at his feet, and he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, the crowd was amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled healed, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. And they glorified the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus summoned his disciples and said, “I feel compassion for the people, because they have remained with me already three days and have nothing to eat. I do not want to send them away hungry, or they might faint on the way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples said to him, “Where can we get so many loaves in the wilderness to satisfy such a large crowd?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus asked them, “How many loaves do you have?”
They said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He instructed the crowd to sit down on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took the seven loaves and the fish, gave thanks, and broke them. He gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were filled. They picked up seven basketfuls of the broken pieces that were left over.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who ate numbered four thousand men, without counting the women and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus sent the crowd away, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to Jesus and, as a test, they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered them, “When it is evening you say, ‘It will be fair weather because the sky is red.’
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning you say, ‘It will be stormy weather today because the sky is red and threatening.’ You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky, but you cannot interpret the signs of the times!
speaker: Narrator

text: An evil and adulterous generation seeks a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.” He left them and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his disciples came to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread along.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Watch out and be on guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were discussing this among themselves and said, “It is because we did not bring any bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Since Jesus knew what they were saying, he said, “You of little faith! Why are you discussing among yourselves the fact that you brought no bread?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you still not understand? Do you not remember the five loaves for the five thousand and how many basketfuls you picked up?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or the seven loaves for the four thousand and how many basketfuls you picked up?
speaker: Narrator

text: How is it that you do not understand that I was not talking to you about bread? But be on guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they understood that he was not warning them about the yeast in bread, but about the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say the Son of Man is?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Some say John the Baptist, others say Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “But you, who do you say that I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell will not overpower it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven. Whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he commanded the disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time, Jesus began to show his disciples that he had to go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders, chief priests, and experts in the law, and be killed, and on the third day be raised again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, “May you receive mercy, Lord! This will never happen to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a snare to me because you are not thinking the things of God, but the things of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone wants to follow me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact whoever wants to save his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all, what will it benefit a person if he gains the whole world, but forfeits his soul? Or what can a person give in exchange for his soul?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father together with his angels, and then he will repay everyone according to his actions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you: Some who are standing here will certainly not taste death until they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days later Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John the brother of James; and he led them up onto a high mountain by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he was transfigured in front of them. His face was shining like the sun. His clothing became as white as the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you want, I will make three shelters here: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, suddenly a bright cloud overshadowed them. Just then, a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased. Listen to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples heard this, they fell face down and were terrified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus approached and as he touched them, he said, “Get up, and do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they opened their eyes, they saw no one except Jesus alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus commanded them, “Do not tell anyone what you have seen until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples asked him, “Then why do the experts in the law say that Elijah must come first?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Yes, Elijah is coming and will restore all things,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I tell you that Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him. Instead they did to him whatever they desired. In the same way the Son of Man will also suffer at their hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples understood that he was talking to them about John the Baptist.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the crowd, a man approached Jesus and knelt in front of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord,” he said, “have mercy on my son because he has seizures and is suffering terribly. He often falls into the fire or into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: I brought him to your disciples, but they were not able to cure him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “O unbelieving and perverse generation! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him here to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus rebuked the demon, and it went out of the boy, and he was cured from that hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why were we unable to drive it out?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Because of your little faith. Amen I tell you: If you have faith like a mustard seed, you will tell this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were gathering together in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will kill him, but on the third day he will be raised.” And they were greatly distressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to Capernaum, those who collected the temple tax came to Peter and said, “Doesn’t your teacher pay the temple tax?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said, “Yes.”
