When he came into the house, Jesus spoke first, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth collect tolls or a tax? From their own sons or from others?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Peter said to him, “From others.”
Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are exempt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But, so that we do not offend them, go to the sea, cast a hook, and take the first fish that you pull up. When you open its mouth, you will find a silver coin. Take that coin and give it to them for me and for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the disciples approached Jesus and asked, “Who then is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus called a little child, had him stand in the middle of them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Amen I tell you: Unless you are turned and become like children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever humbles himself like this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever receives a little child like this one in my name receives me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But, if anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a huge millstone hung around his neck and to be drowned in the depths of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to the world because of temptations to sin. Temptations must come, but woe to that person through whom the temptation comes!
speaker: Narrator

text: “If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to enter life crippled or lame than to be thrown into the eternal fire with two hands or two feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: If your eye causes you to sin, pluck it out and throw it away from you. It is better for you to enter life with one eye than to be thrown into hell fire with two eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: See to it that you do not look down on one of these little ones, because I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man came to save what was lost.
speaker: Narrator

text: “What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep, and one of them wanders away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go looking for the one that wandered away?
speaker: Narrator

text: If he finds it—Amen I tell you—he rejoices more over that one sheep than over the ninety-nine that did not wander away.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, your Father in heaven does not want even one of these little ones to perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If your brother sins against you, go and show him his sin just between the two of you. If he listens to you, you have regained your brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he will not listen, take one or two others along with you, so that ‘every matter may be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.’
speaker: Narrator

text: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church. And, if he refuses to listen even to the church, then treat him as an unbeliever or a tax collector.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you: Whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you again: If two of you on earth agree to ask for anything, it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact where two or three have gathered together in my name, there I am among them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter came up and asked Jesus, “Lord, how many times must I forgive my brother when he sins against me? As many as seven times?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Not seven times, but I tell you as many as seventy-seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason the kingdom of heaven is like a king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he began to settle them, a man who owed him ten thousand talents was brought to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the man was not able to pay the debt, his master ordered that he be sold, along with his wife, children, and all that he owned to repay the debt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the servant fell down on his knees in front of him, saying, ‘Master, be patient with me, and I will pay you everything!’
speaker: Narrator

text: The master of that servant had pity on him, released him, and forgave him the debt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But when that servant went out, he found one of his fellow servants who owed him one hundred denarii. He grabbed him and began choking him, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So his fellow servant fell down and begged him, saying, ‘Be patient with me, and I will pay you back!’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he refused. Instead he went off and threw the man into prison until he could pay back what he owed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When his fellow servants saw what had happened, they were very distressed. They went and reported to their master everything that had taken place.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then his master called him in and said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt when you begged me to.
speaker: Narrator

text: Should you not have had mercy on your fellow servant just as I had mercy on you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: His master was angry and handed him over to the jailers until he could pay back everything he owed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is what my heavenly Father will also do to you unless each one of you forgives his brother from his heart.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he left Galilee and went to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some Pharisees came in order to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “Haven’t you read that from the beginning their Maker ‘made them male and female,’
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will be one flesh’?
speaker: Narrator

text: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, man must not separate.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked him, “Then why did Moses command a man to give her a certificate of divorce and send her away?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Because of your hard hearts, Moses permitted you to divorce your wives, but it was not that way from the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that whoever divorces his wife, except on the grounds of her sexual immorality, and marries another woman is committing adultery.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples said to him, “If this is the relationship of a man with his wife, it is better not to marry.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “Not everyone can accept this saying, but only those to whom it has been given.
speaker: Narrator

text: For example, there are eunuchs who were born that way, and others who were castrated by people, and others who decided to remain unmarried because of the kingdom of heaven. The one who is able to accept this should accept it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some people brought little children to Jesus to have him place his hands on them and pray. But the disciples rebuked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said, “Let the little children come to me and do not hinder them, because the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After he placed his hands on them, he left that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a man who came to him and said, “Teacher, what good thing should I do that I may have eternal life?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Why do you ask me about what is good? Only one is good. But if you want to enter life, keep the commandments.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Which ones?” the man asked him.
Jesus said, “‘You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not give false testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor your father and mother.’ And, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The young man said to him, “I have kept all these. What am I still lacking?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell your possessions, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the young man heard this, he went away sad, because he had many possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to his disciples, “Amen I tell you: It will be very hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again I tell you: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples heard this, they were greatly astonished and said, “Who then can be saved?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus looked at them and said, “With people this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter answered, “Look, we have left everything and followed you! What then will we have?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Amen I tell you: In the renewal, when the Son of Man sits on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who has left homes or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or fields, because of my name, will receive a hundred times as much and will inherit eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many who are first will be last, and many who are last will be first.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Indeed the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: After agreeing to pay the workers a denarius for the day, he sent them into his vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also went out about the third hour and saw others standing unemployed in the marketplace.
speaker: Narrator

text: To these he said, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and I will give you whatever is right.’ So they went.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour and did the same thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he went out about the eleventh hour, he found others standing unemployed. He said to them, ‘Why have you stood here all day unemployed?’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’
“He told them, ‘You also go into the vineyard.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, starting with the last group and ending with the first.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “When those who were hired around the eleventh hour came, they each received a denarius.
speaker: Narrator

text: When those who were hired first came, they thought they would receive more. But they each received a denarius too.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they received it, they began to grumble against the landowner:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Those who were last worked one hour, and you made them equal to us who have endured the burden of the day and the scorching heat!’
speaker: Narrator

text: “But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Did you not make an agreement with me for a denarius?
speaker: Narrator

text: Take what is yours and go. I want to give to the last one hired the same as I also gave to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Can’t I do what I want with my own money? Or are you envious because I am generous?’
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, the last will be first, and the first, last.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside; and on the way he said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and experts in the law, and they will condemn him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will hand him over to the Gentiles to mock, flog, and crucify him. On the third day he will be raised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to him with her sons, kneeling and asking something of him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said to her, “What do you want?”
She said to him, “Promise that in your kingdom these two sons of mine may sit, one on your right hand and one on your left hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Jesus answered, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink?”
They said to him, “We are.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “You will indeed drink my cup, but to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not for me to give; rather these places belong to those for whom they have been prepared by my Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the ten heard this, they were angry with the two brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus summoned them and said, “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will not be that way among you. Instead whoever wants to become great among you will be your servant,
speaker: Narrator

text: and whoever wants to be first among you will be your slave—
speaker: Narrator

text: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were two blind men sitting by the road. When they heard that Jesus was passing by, they shouted, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd rebuked them, telling them to be quiet. But they shouted even louder, “Have mercy on us, Lord, Son of David!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus stopped and called them. “What do you want me to do for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They told him, “Lord, open our eyes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus was moved with compassion and touched their eyes. Immediately they regained their sight, and they followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: telling them, “Go to the village ahead of you. Immediately you will find a donkey tied there along with her colt. Untie them and bring them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone says anything to you, you are to say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and he will send them at once.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell the daughter of Zion: Look, your King comes to you, humble, and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples went and did just as Jesus commanded them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the donkey and the colt, laid their outer clothing on them, and he sat on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A very large crowd spread their outer clothing on the road. Others were cutting branches from the trees and spreading them out on the road.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The crowds who went in front of him and those who followed kept shouting,
Hosanna to the Son of David!
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!
Hosanna in the highest!
speaker: Narrator

text: When he entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred up, asking, “Who is this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the crowds were saying, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus entered the temple courts and drove out all those who were selling and buying in the temple. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who were selling doves.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it a den of robbers!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The blind and the lame came to him in the temple, and he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the chief priests and the experts in the law saw the wonders he performed and heard the children calling out in the temple, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” they were indignant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They said to him, “Do you hear what they are saying?”
“Yes,” Jesus told them, “Have you never read,
    From the lips of little children and nursing babies
    you have prepared praise?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He left them, went out of the city to Bethany, and spent the night there.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he returned to the city early in the morning, he was hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seeing a fig tree by the road, he went up to it but found nothing on it except leaves. He said to it, “May there never be fruit from you again!”
Immediately the fig tree withered away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples saw it, they were amazed and asked, “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Amen I tell you: If you have faith, and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ it would be done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever you ask for in prayer, as you believe, you will receive.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus went into the temple courts, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him while he was teaching and said, “By what authority are you doing these things?” and “Who gave you this authority?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “I will also ask you one question. If you answer it, I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The baptism of John, where was it from? From heaven or from men?”
They discussed it among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say to us, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we are afraid of the crowd, since they all regard John as a prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they answered Jesus, “We do not know.”
He said to them, “Then I will not tell you by what authority I do these things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “What do you think? A man had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, ‘I will not,’ but later he changed his mind and went.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to the second and said the same thing. The second son answered, ‘I will go, sir,’ but he did not go.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Which of the two did the will of his father?”
They said to him, “The first.”
Jesus said to them, “Amen I tell you: The tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God ahead of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, but you did not believe him. However, the tax collectors and prostitutes did believe him. Even when you saw this, you did not change your mind and believe him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Listen to another parable. There was a landowner who planted a vineyard, put a fence around it, dug a winepress in it, and built a watchtower. He leased it out to some tenant farmers and went away on a journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the time approached to harvest the fruit, he sent his servants to the tenants to get his fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tenant farmers seized his servants. They beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the landowner sent even more servants than the first time. The tenant farmers treated them the same way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, he sent his son to them. ‘They will respect my son,’ he said.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the tenant farmers saw the son, they said to each other, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and take his inheritance!’
speaker: Narrator

text: They took him, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the landowner comes, what will he do to those tenant farmers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They told him, “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end. Then he will lease out the vineyard to other tenants who will give him his fruit when it is due.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures:
The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
This was the Lord’s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: “That is why I tell you the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people that produces its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, and it will crush anyone on whom it falls.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they knew that he was talking about them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Although they were looking for a way to arrest him, they were afraid of the crowds because the people regarded him as a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus spoke to them again in parables. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: He sent out his servants to summon those who were invited to the wedding banquet, but they did not want to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then he sent out other servants and said, ‘Tell those who are invited: Look, I have prepared my dinner. My oxen and my fattened cattle have been butchered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet!’
speaker: Narrator

text: “But those who were invited paid no attention and went off, one to his own farm, another to his business.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest seized the king’s servants, mistreated them, and killed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, the king was very angry. He sent his army and killed those murderers and burned their town.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding banquet is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So go to the main crossroads and invite as many as you find to the wedding banquet.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Those servants went out to the roads and gathered together everyone they found, both good and bad, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without wearing wedding clothes?’ The man was speechless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king told the servants, ‘Tie him hand and foot and throw him into the outer darkness where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For many are called, but few are chosen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees went out and plotted together how to trap him in his words.
speaker: Narrator

text: They sent their disciples to him along with the Herodians. “Teacher,” they said, “we know that you are truthful and teach the way of God in accord with the truth. You are not concerned about gaining anyone’s approval because you are not swayed by appearances.
speaker: Narrator

text: So tell us, what do you think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus knew their evil purpose and said, “Why are you testing me, hypocrites?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Show me the coin used for the tax.”
They brought him a denarius.
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked them, “Whose image and inscription is this?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Caesar’s,” they replied to him.
Then he said to them, “Therefore give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard this, they were amazed. Then they left him and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: That same day some Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) came to him. They asked him a question:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies without having children, his brother should marry his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one died after he married her, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was the same with the second brother, the third, and all the way to the seventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Last of all, the woman died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, in the resurrection, whose wife will she be of the seven, since they all married her?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are mistaken,” Jesus replied, “since you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, in the resurrection people neither marry nor are given in marriage. Instead they are like the angels of God in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you never read what was spoken to you by God:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowds heard his answer, they were amazed at his teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees met together.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of them who was an expert in the law asked him a question, trying to trap him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment of the Law?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the first and greatest commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Law and the Prophets depend on these two commandments.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?”
They said to him, “The Son of David.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Then how can David in the Spirit call him Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord said to my Lord,
    ‘Sit at my right hand,
    until I put your enemies
    under your feet’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: “So if David calls him Lord, how is he his son?”
speaker: Narrator

text: No one was able to answer him a word, and from that day on no one dared to ask him any more questions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “The experts in the law and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.
speaker: Narrator

text: So practice and observe whatever they tell you. But do not do as they do, because they do not practice what they preach.
speaker: Narrator

text: They tie up heavy loads, burdens that are hard to carry, and place them on people’s shoulders, but they will not lift a finger to help them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do all their works to be seen by people. They make their phylacteries wide and lengthen the fringes of their garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: They love the place of honor at feasts, the best seats in the synagogues,
speaker: Narrator

text: the greetings in the marketplaces, and being called ‘Rabbi’ by people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have one Teacher, and you are all brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also do not call anyone on earth your ‘Father,’ for you have one Father, and he is in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you are not to be called ‘leaders,’ for you have one Leader, the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the greatest among you will be your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But woe to you, experts in the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You shut the kingdom of heaven right in front of people’s faces. You yourselves do not enter, nor do you permit those who are trying to enter to do so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you, experts in the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You travel the sea and the land to make one convert, and then when he is converted, you make him twice as much a son of hell as you are.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You blind fools! After all, which is greater: the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?
speaker: Narrator

text: And you say, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obligated.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You blind men! After all, which is greater: the gift or the altar that sanctifies the gift?
speaker: Narrator

text: So whoever swears by the altar, swears by it and by everything on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also, whoever swears by the temple, swears by it and by him who dwells in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever swears by heaven, swears by God’s throne and by him who sits on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You give ten percent of your mint, dill, and cumin, but you have neglected the more important matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faith. You should have done these things and not failed to do the other things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blind guides, you strain out a gnat but swallow a camel!
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of a cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blind Pharisee, first clean the inside of the cup and dish so that the outside may become clean too.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs that appear beautiful on the outside, but on the inside are full of dead people’s bones and every kind of uncleanness.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, on the outside you seem righteous to people, but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, experts in the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the monuments of the righteous,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have joined with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’
speaker: Narrator

text: By saying this you testify against yourselves that you are sons of those who murdered the prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: You serpents, you offspring of vipers, how will you escape being condemned to hell?
speaker: Narrator

text: “Look, this is why I am sending you prophets, wise men, and experts in the law. Some of them you will kill and crucify, and some of them you will flog in your synagogues and persecute from town to town.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, you will be held responsible for all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the sanctuary and the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you: All these things will come upon this generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those sent to her! How often I have wanted to gather your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!
speaker: Narrator

text: Look, your house is left to you desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I tell you, you will certainly not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus left the temple and was walking away, his disciples came up to him to call his attention to the temple buildings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he replied to them, “Do you see all of these things? Amen I tell you: Not one stone here will be left on another that will not be thrown down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately and said, “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the world?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Watch out that no one deceives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will deceive many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not alarmed, because all these things must happen; but that is not yet the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all these things are only the beginning of birth pains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will hand you over to be persecuted, and they will put you to death. You will be hated by all nations because of my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then many will fall away from faith. They will betray each other and hate each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many false prophets will appear and deceive many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because lawlessness will increase, the love of many will grow cold.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whoever endures to the end will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: This gospel of the kingdom will be proclaimed throughout the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore when you see the abomination that causes desolation, that was spoken of through the prophet Daniel, standing in the holy place—let the reader understand—
speaker: Narrator

text: then those who are in Judea should flee to the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one on the housetop should not go down to take anything out of his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who is in the field should not return to get his clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: How terrible it will be for those who are pregnant or are nursing babies in those days!
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray that your flight will not take place in the winter or on a Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For at that time there will be great distress, unlike any that has happened since the beginning of the world until now, and unlike any that will happen again.
speaker: Narrator

text: If those days were not shortened, nobody would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, those days will be shortened.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ,’ or ‘There he is,’ do not believe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For false Christs and false prophets will arise and will perform great signs and wonders so as to deceive even the elect, if it were possible.
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I have told you in advance.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if they tell you, ‘Look! There he is in the wilderness,’ do not go out there, or ‘Look! Here he is in the inner rooms,’ do not believe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the lightning flashes from the east and shines as far as the west, so it will be when the Son of Man comes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherever the carcass may be, there the vultures will gather.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Immediately after the misery of those days, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. And at that time all the nations of the earth will mourn. They will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will send out his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Learn this lesson from the fig tree. When its branch has become tender and produces leaves, you know that summer is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, when you see all these things, know that he is near, right at the doors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you: This generation will certainly not pass away until all these things take place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No one knows when that day and hour will be, not the angels of heaven, not even the Son, but only the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as it was in the days of Noah, so it will be when the Son of Man returns.
speaker: Narrator

text: In fact, in the days before the flood people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the very day that Noah entered the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did not realize what was coming until the flood came and took them all away. That is how it will be when the Son of Man returns.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time two men will be in the field; one will be taken and one will be left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two women will be grinding at the mill; one will be taken and one will be left.
speaker: Narrator

text: So be alert, because you do not know on what day your Lord is coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: But understand this: If the master of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have stayed awake and would not have let his house be broken into.
speaker: Narrator

text: You also need to be ready for this reason: The Son of Man is coming at an hour when you do not expect him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom his master has put in charge of his household, to give them their food at the proper time?
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is that servant whom his master finds doing this when he returns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you: He will put him in charge of all that he has.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if that servant is wicked and says in his heart, ‘My master is staying away a long time,’
speaker: Narrator

text: and he begins to beat his fellow servants and eats and drinks with drunkards,
speaker: Narrator

text: the master of that servant will return on a day when he does not expect it and at an hour he does not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: The master will cut him in two and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the foolish ones took their lamps, they did not take any oil with them;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the wise took oil in their containers with their lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: While the bridegroom was delayed, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: But at midnight there was a shout, ‘Look, the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all those virgins got up and trimmed their lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil because our lamps are going out.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wise answered, ‘No, there may not be enough for us and for you. Instead, go to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But while they were away buying oil, the bridegroom came. Those who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet, and the door was shut.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, the other virgins also came and said, ‘Lord, Lord, let us in.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered, ‘Amen I tell you: I do not know you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, keep watch, because you do not know the day or the hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You see, the kingdom of heaven is like a man going on a journey. He called his servants and entrusted his possessions to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: To one he gave five talents, to another two talents, and to still another one talent, each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: The servant who had received the five talents immediately put them to work and gained five more talents.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, the servant who had received the two talents gained two more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the servant who had received one talent went away, dug a hole in the ground, and hid his master’s money.
speaker: Narrator

text: “After a long time the master of those servants came and settled accounts with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The servant who received the five talents came and brought five more talents. He said, ‘Master, you entrusted five talents to me. See, I have gained five more talents.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You were faithful with a few things. I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “The servant who received the two talents came and said, ‘Master, you entrusted me with two talents. See, I have gained two more talents.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You were faithful with a few things. I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the servant who received one talent came and said, ‘Master, I knew that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not plant and gathering where you did not scatter seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since I was afraid, I went away and hid your talent in the ground. See, you have what is yours.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “His master answered him, ‘You wicked and lazy servant! You knew that I reap where I did not plant and gather where I did not scatter seed?
speaker: Narrator

text: Well then, you should have deposited my money with the bankers so that when I came I would get my money back with interest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the talent away from him and give it to the servant who has the ten talents.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because everyone who has will be given more, and he will have an abundance. But the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Throw that worthless servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, he will sit on his glorious throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the nations will be gathered in his presence, and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the King will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was hungry and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink. I was a stranger and you welcomed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was lacking clothes and you clothed me. I was sick and you took care of me. I was in prison and you visited me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the righteous will answer him, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you a drink?
speaker: Narrator

text: When did we see you a stranger and welcome you, or lacking clothes and clothe you?
speaker: Narrator

text: When did we see you sick or in prison and visit you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: “The King will answer them, ‘Amen I tell you: Just as you did it for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did it for me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire, which is prepared for the Devil and his angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was hungry and you did not give me food to eat. I was thirsty and you did not give me anything to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was a stranger and you did not welcome me, lacking clothes and you did not clothe me, sick and in prison and you did not take care of me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then they will also answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or lacking clothes or sick or in prison and did not serve you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time he will answer them, ‘Amen I tell you: Just as you did not do it for one of the least of these, you did not do it for me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will go away to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he said to his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You know that after two days it will be the Passover, and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people assembled in the palace of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas.
speaker: Narrator

text: They plotted together how to arrest Jesus by stealth and kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they said, “Not during the Festival, or else there might be a riot among the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,
speaker: Narrator

text: a woman approached him holding an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume. She poured it on his head as he was reclining at the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when his disciples saw this, they were upset and said, “Why this waste?
speaker: Narrator

text: This perfume could have been sold for a lot of money and given to the poor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus was aware of this and said to them, “Why are you causing trouble for this woman? She has done a beautiful thing for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are always going to have the poor with you, but you are not always going to have me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she poured this perfume on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amen I tell you: Wherever this gospel is proclaimed in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told in memory of her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then one of the Twelve, the one named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “What are you willing to give me if I hand him over to you?” They paid him thirty pieces of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time on Judas was looking for an opportunity to betray Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Where do you want us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Go into the city to a certain man and tell him the Teacher says, ‘My time is near. I will observe the Passover with my disciples at your house.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples did as Jesus commanded them and prepared the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening came, Jesus was reclining at the table with the Twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were eating, he said, “Amen I tell you: One of you will betray me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were very sad and began to say to him one after another, “Surely, not I, Lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He replied, “The one who dipped his hand in the bowl with me will betray me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man is going just as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judas, who betrayed him, replied, “Surely, not I, Rabbi?”
He said to him, “Yes, you are the one.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to the disciples. He said, “Take, eat, this is my body.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he took the cup, gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it all of you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for this is my blood of the new testament, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you that I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After they sang a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to them, “This night you will all fall away on account of me, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But after I have been raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter answered him, “Even if all fall away because of you, I will never fall away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Amen I tell you: Tonight before the rooster crows you will deny me three times.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never deny you.” And all the disciples said the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane. He told his disciples, “Sit here, while I go over there and pray.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and he began to be sorrowful and distressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “My soul is very sorrowful, even to the point of death. Stay here, and keep watch with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He went a little farther, fell on his face, and prayed. He said, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from me. Yet not as I will, but as you will.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to the disciples and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “So, were you not able to stay awake with me for one hour?
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch and pray, so that you do not enter into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He went away a second time and prayed, “My Father, if it is not possible for this cup to pass from me unless I drink it, may your will be done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he returned and found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left them again, went away, and prayed a third time. He said the same words as before.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he returned to his disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour is near, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rise. Let us go. Look, my betrayer is near.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Jesus was still speaking, suddenly Judas (one of the Twelve) arrived. With him was a large crowd with swords and clubs, who came from the chief priests and elders of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the betrayer had given them a sign: “The one I kiss is the man. Arrest him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately he went to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus said to him, “Friend, why are you here?”
Then they advanced, took hold of Jesus, and arrested him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, one of the men with Jesus reached out his hand, drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back into its place, because all who take the sword will die by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not realize that I could call on my Father, and at once he would provide me with more than twelve legions of angels?
speaker: Narrator

text: But then how would the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen this way?”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that same time Jesus said to the crowd, “Have you come out to arrest me with swords and clubs as if I were a robber? Day after day I was sitting in the temple courts teaching, and you did not arrest me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all this has happened so that the writings of the prophets would be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples deserted him and fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who had arrested Jesus led him away to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the experts in the law and the elders were assembled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter was following him at a distance and went as far as the courtyard of the high priest. He went inside and sat down with the guards to see how it would turn out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false testimony against Jesus so that they could put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: They found none, even though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The high priest stood up and said to him, “Have you no answer? What is this that these men are testifying against you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus remained silent. Then the high priest said to him, “I place you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “It is as you have said. But I tell you, soon you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest tore his robes and said, “He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? See, you have just heard the blasphemy!
speaker: Narrator

text:
What do you think?”
They answered, “He is deserving of death!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they spit in his face and punched him. Some slapped him
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Prophesy to us, Christ! Who hit you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard. A servant girl came to him and said, “You were also with Jesus the Galilean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it in front of everyone, saying, “I don’t know what you’re talking about.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter went out to the entryway, someone else saw him and said to those who were there, “This fellow was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Peter denied it with an oath and said, “I do not know the man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After a little while those who stood by came and said to Peter, “Surely you are also one of them because even your accent gives you away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he began to curse and to swear, “I do not know the man!” Just then the rooster crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” And he went outside and wept bitterly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people reached the decision to put Jesus to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: They bound him, led him away, and handed him over to Pontius Pilate, the governor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then when Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus was condemned, he felt remorse. He brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood.” But they said, “What is that to us? That’s your problem.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He threw the pieces of silver into the temple and left. Then he went out and hanged himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests took the pieces of silver and said, “It is not lawful to put these into the treasury, since it is blood money.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They reached a decision to buy the potter’s field with the money, as a burial place for foreigners.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that field has been called The Field of Blood to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then what was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled:
They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price the sons of Israel had set for him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they gave them for the potter’s field, just as the Lord commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Jesus stood in the presence of the governor, the governor asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
Jesus said to him, “It is as you say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate said to him, “Don’t you hear how many things they are testifying against you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not answer him—not even one word, so that the governor was very surprised.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the time of the Festival the governor had a custom to release to the crowd any one prisoner they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time they were holding a notorious prisoner named Barabbas.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when they were assembled, Pilate said to them, “Which one do you want me to release to you? Barabbas—or Jesus, who is called Christ?”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Pilate knew that they had handed Jesus over to him because of envy.
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, Pilate’s wife sent him a message. “Have nothing to do with that righteous man,” she said, “since I have suffered many things today in a dream because of him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The governor asked them, “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?”
“Barabbas!” they said.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pilate said to them, “Then what should I do with Jesus, who is called Christ?”
They all said to him, “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the governor said, “Why? What has he done wrong?”
But they kept shouting even louder: “Crucify him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate saw that he was accomplishing nothing and that instead it was turning into a riot, he took water, washed his hands in front of the crowd, and said, “I am innocent of this righteous man’s blood. It is your responsibility.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people answered, “Let his blood be on us and on our children!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he released Barabbas to them, but he had Jesus flogged and handed him over to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole cohort of soldiers around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They twisted together a crown of thorns and put it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand, knelt in front of him, and mocked him by saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They spit on him, took the staff, and hit him repeatedly on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had mocked him, they took off the robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were going out of the city, they found a man of Cyrene named Simon. They forced him to carry Jesus’ cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to a place called Golgotha, which means “The place of the skull.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They offered Jesus wine to drink, mixed with gall; but when he tasted it, he would not drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among themselves by casting lots.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they sat down and were keeping watch over him there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above his head they posted the written charge against him: “This is Jesus, the King of the Jews.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time two criminals were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: People who passed by kept insulting him, shaking their heads,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “You who were going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way the chief priests, experts in the law, and elders kept mocking him. They said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “He saved others, but he cannot save himself. If he’s the King of Israel, let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He trusts in God. Let God rescue him now, if he wants him, because he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way even the criminals who were crucified with him kept insulting him.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the sixth hour until the ninth hour, there was darkness over all the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: About the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” which means “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When some of those standing there heard this, they said, “This fellow is calling for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately one of them ran, took a sponge, and soaked it with sour wine. Then he put it on a stick and gave him a drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest said, “Leave him alone. Let’s see if Elijah comes to save him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus cried out again with a loud voice, he gave up his spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, the temple curtain was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook and rocks were split.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tombs were opened, and many bodies of saints who had fallen asleep were raised to life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who came out of the tombs went into the holy city after Jesus’ resurrection and appeared to many people.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the centurion and those who were guarding Jesus with him saw the earthquake and the things that had happened, they were terrified and said, “Truly this was the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many women who had followed Jesus from Galilee and who had served him were there, watching from a distance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who was also a disciple of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered that it be given to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and laid it in his own new tomb that he had cut in the rock. He rolled a large stone over the tomb’s entrance and left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were there sitting opposite the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day, which was the day after the Preparation Day, the chief priests and Pharisees gathered in the presence of Pilate
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Sir, we remembered what that deceiver said while he was still alive: ‘After three days I will rise again.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So give a command that the tomb be made secure until the third day. Otherwise his disciples might steal his body and tell the people, ‘He is risen from the dead.’ And this last deception will be worse than the first.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard. Go, make it as secure as you know how.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went and made the tomb secure by sealing the stone and posting a guard.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly, there was a great earthquake! For an angel of the Lord came down from heaven, and going to the tomb, he rolled away the stone and was sitting on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing was as white as snow.
speaker: Narrator

text: The guards were so terrified of him that they shook and became like dead men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid! I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is not here. He has risen, just as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go quickly and tell his disciples, ‘He has risen from the dead! And look, he is going ahead of you to Galilee. There you will see him.’ See, I have told you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They hurried away from the tomb, with fear and great joy, and ran to tell his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Suddenly Jesus met them and said, “Greetings!”
They approached, took hold of his feet, and worshipped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go, tell my brothers that they should go to Galilee, and there they will see me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were on their way, there were some members of the guard who went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the chief priests had assembled with the elders and had reached a decision, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came at night and stole him away while we were sleeping.’
speaker: Narrator

text: If the governor hears about it, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After the soldiers took the money, they did as they were instructed. And this story has been repeated among the Jews until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had directed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw him, they worshipped him, but some hesitated because they were uncertain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus approached and spoke to them saying, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore go and gather disciples from all nations by baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: and by teaching them to keep all the instructions I have given you. And surely I am with you always until the end of the age.”
speaker: Narrator
